Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Gerson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 151 Mulberry Street, in Community Board 2, Manhattan, No. 20075017 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 151 Mulberry Street, Inc., Manhattan (20075017TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Gerson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 191 Grand Street, in Community Board 2, Manhattan, No. 20075018 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 191 Grand Restaurant Corp., Manhattan (20075018TCM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend section seventeen of local law number fifteen for the year two thousand six, relating to the reporting of lobbyist activities and the enforcement of the lobbying law, in relation to the effective date of local law number fifteen.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amend section 17 of LL 15 of 2006, relating to the reporting of lobbyist activities and the enforcement of the lobbying law, in relation to the effective date of LL 15.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the establishment of an affordable housing fund and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Establishment of an affordable housing fund in relation to benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Water Board to abolish the minimum charge for water and wastewater treatment services, irrespective of the amount of water consumed each billing period.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Abolish the minimum charge for water and wastewater treatment services, irrespective of the amount of water consumed each billing period.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the eligibility for benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law and the affordability of the dwelling units.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Eligibility for benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law and the affordability of the dwelling units.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the removal of raccoons.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limitations on the eligibility for benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law relating to affordability of the dwelling units.

Items.MatterName: Limitations on the eligibility for benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law relating to affordability of the dwelling units.
